page.title: 01GAZETTEER-CATTERICK-TUNSTALL
page.content: The block mainly consists of farming land. The majority of farms being owned by North Yorkshire County Council. Most of the farms were originally instituted by the council for men returning home from the great war. Initially the tenancy was handed down from father to son but, in recent years, the council policy has been to rescind the tenancy of the smaller farms and divide the land amongst neighbouring farmers. The area is greatly influenced by both the R.A.F. station and the Army Garrison, which are close by. Both camps provide employment, influence peoples home life and life style. Recreation and religion play a major part in the area as do local history, tourism and trade. All of which affect residents thoughts and hopes for the future.
